result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. RAMON E SAVAGE

Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:51 PM Defendant RAMON E SAVAGE appeared by video.  Attorney Ryan S Van Ells in court for RAMON E SAVAGE.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony Prekop in court for the State of Wisconsin. Information received by Defendant, waives formal reading and enters a not guilty plea. Court in compliance with Marsy's Law/victim rights.  Address verified - no change.  Bond continues.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No contact with V1 in OPD report 22-27459. Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are. No pandering. Do not leave the State of Wisconsin.

10:11 AM Prosecuting attorney Amanda Nash in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant RAMON E SAVAGE appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan S Van Ells in court for RAMON E SAVAGE. DE request lower cash bond or sig bond. State objects. Court grants request. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement. Record closed @ 1021
Arraignment scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
